AppSource.Documentation: // A Source object that describes the app repository.

Domains.Documentation:
// The app vhost settings with multiple domains separated by commas. For example:
// 'www.example.com, example.com'

EnableSsl.Documentation: // Whether to enable SSL for the app.

SslConfiguration.Documentation: // An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

LayerIds.Documentation:
// The layer ID, which must correspond to a custom layer. You cannot assign
// a registered instance to a built-in layer.

Ref.Documentation:
// The layer ID, which must correspond to a custom layer. You cannot assign
// a registered instance to a built-in layer.

ElasticLoadBalancerName.Documentation: // The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.

LayerId.Documentation:
// The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is to be attached
// to.

Ref.Documentation: // The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.

// The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is to be attached
// to.

AutoScalingThresholds.Documentation:
// Describes a load-based auto scaling upscaling or downscaling threshold configuration,
// which specifies when AWS OpsWorks starts or stops load-based instances.

CpuThreshold.Documentation:
// The CPU utilization threshold, as a percent of the available CPU. A value
// of -1 disables the threshold.

InstanceCount.Documentation: // The number of instances to add or remove when the load exceeds a threshold.

LoadThreshold.Documentation:
// The load threshold. A value of -1 disables the threshold. For more information
// about how load is computed, see Load (computing) (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Load_%28computing%29).

MemoryThreshold.Documentation:
// The memory utilization threshold, as a percent of the available memory. A
// value of -1 disables the threshold.

ThresholdsWaitTime.Documentation:
// The amount of time, in minutes, that the load must exceed a threshold before
// more instances are added or removed.

Ref.Documentation:
// The amount of time, in minutes, that the load must exceed a threshold before
// more instances are added or removed.

Ebs.Documentation:
// An EBSBlockDevice that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS volume when
// the instance is launched.

NoDevice.Documentation: // Suppresses the specified device included in the AMI's block device mapping.

VirtualName.Documentation: // The virtual device name. For more information, see BlockDeviceMapping (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_BlockDeviceMapping.html).

Attributes.Documentation:
// A list of stack attributes and values as key/value pairs to be added to the
// cloned stack.

CloneAppIds.Documentation: // A list of source stack app IDs to be included in the cloned stack.

ClonePermissions.Documentation: // Whether to clone the source stack's permissions.

Region.Documentation:
// The cloned stack AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about
// AWS regions, see Regions and Endpoints (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

CloneStackOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a CloneStack request.

AcknowledgedAt.Documentation: // Date and time when the command was acknowledged.

CreatedAt.Documentation: // Date and time when the command was run.

InstanceId.Documentation: // The ID of the instance where the command was executed.

LogUrl.Documentation: // The URL of the command log.

AppSource.Documentation: // A Source object that specifies the app repository.

Attributes.Documentation: // One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

Domains.Documentation:
// The app virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by commas.
// For example: 'www.example.com, example.com'

EnableSsl.Documentation: // Whether to enable SSL for the app.

SslConfiguration.Documentation: // An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

Ref.Documentation: // An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

AppId.Documentation:
// The app ID. This parameter is required for app deployments, but not for other

Command.Documentation:

InstanceIds.Documentation: // The instance IDs for the deployment targets.

LayerIds.Documentation: // The layer IDs for the deployment targets.

Ref.Documentation:
// A DeploymentCommand object that specifies the deployment command and any
// associated arguments.

// A DeploymentCommand object that specifies the deployment command and any

DeploymentId.Documentation:
// The deployment ID, which can be used with other requests to identify the

AutoScalingType.Documentation:
// For load-based or time-based instances, the type. Windows stacks can use
// only time-based instances.

AvailabilityZone.Documentation:
// The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints
// (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

EbsOptimized.Documentation: // Whether to create an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.

LayerIds.Documentation: // An array that contains the instance's layer IDs.

RootDeviceType.Documentation:
// The instance root device type. For more information, see Storage for the
// Root Device (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ComponentsAMIs.html#storage-for-the-root-device).

SshKeyName.Documentation: // The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.

VirtualizationType.Documentation: // The instance's virtualization type, paravirtual or hvm.

Ref.Documentation: // An array that contains the instance's layer IDs.

CreateInstanceOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a CreateInstance request.

AutoAssignElasticIps.Documentation:
// Whether to automatically assign an Elastic IP address (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/elastic-ip-addresses-eip.html)
// to the layer's instances. For more information, see How to Edit a Layer (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/userguide/workinglayers-basics-edit.html).

CustomInstanceProfileArn.Documentation:
// The ARN of an IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances. For more
// information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/Using_Identifiers.html).

CustomRecipes.Documentation: // A LayerCustomRecipes object that specifies the layer custom recipes.

CustomSecurityGroupIds.Documentation: // An array containing the layer custom security group IDs.

EnableAutoHealing.Documentation: // Whether to disable auto healing for the layer.

Name.Documentation: // The layer name, which is used by the console.

Packages.Documentation: // An array of Package objects that describes the layer packages.

UseEbsOptimizedInstances.Documentation: // Whether to use Amazon EBS-optimized instances.

VolumeConfigurations.Documentation: // A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.

Ref.Documentation: // The layer name, which is used by the console.

Attributes.Documentation: // One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

Region.Documentation:
// The stack's AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about Amazon

UseCustomCookbooks.Documentation: // Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

Ref.Documentation:
// The stack's AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about Amazon

StackId.Documentation:

AllowSelfManagement.Documentation:
// Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My Settings

Type.Documentation:

// or RdsDbInstance.

DeleteElasticIp.Documentation: // Whether to delete the instance Elastic IP address.

DeleteVolumes.Documentation: // Whether to delete the instance's Amazon EBS volumes.

Deployment.Documentation: // Describes a deployment of a stack or app.

CreatedAt.Documentation: // Date when the deployment was created.

InstanceIds.Documentation: // The IDs of the target instances.

DeploymentCommand.Documentation: // Used to specify a stack or deployment command.

StackId.Documentation:

DeploymentId.Documentation:
// The deployment ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeCommands returns

StackId.Documentation:

InstanceId.Documentation:
// The instance ID. If you include this parameter, DescribeElasticIps returns

StackId.Documentation:

StackId.Documentation:

Parameters.Documentation: // An embedded object that contains the provisioning parameters.

TimeBasedAutoScalingConfigurations.Documentation:

InstanceId.Documentation:

RaidArrayId.Documentation:

StackId.Documentation: // A stack ID. The action describes the stack's registered Amazon EBS volumes.

ElasticLoadBalancerName.Documentation: // The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.

LayerId.Documentation:
// The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is attached

Ref.Documentation: // The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.

// The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is attached
// to.

DeleteOnTermination.Documentation: // Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.

Iops.Documentation:
// The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.
// For more information, see EbsBlockDevice (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_EbsBlockDevice.html).

VolumeSize.Documentation: // The volume size, in GiB. For more information, see EbsBlockDevice (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_EbsBlockDevice.html).

VolumeType.Documentation:
// The volume type. gp2 for General Purpose (SSD) volumes, io1 for Provisioned
// IOPS (SSD) volumes, and standard for Magnetic volumes.

EcsCluster.Documentation: // Describes a registered Amazon ECS cluster.

RegisteredAt.Documentation: // The time and date that the cluster was registered with the stack.

InstanceId.Documentation: // The ID of the instance that the address is attached to.

Region.Documentation: // The AWS region. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

ElasticLoadBalancer.Documentation: // Describes an Elastic Load Balancing instance.

Ec2InstanceIds.Documentation:
// A list of the EC2 instances that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is managing
// traffic for.

ElasticLoadBalancerName.Documentation: // The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.

LayerId.Documentation: // The ID of the layer that the instance is attached to.

StackId.Documentation: // The ID of the stack that the instance is associated with.

SubnetIds.Documentation: // A list of subnet IDs, if the stack is running in a VPC.

GetHostnameSuggestionOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a GetHostnameSuggestion request.

GrantAccessOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a GrantAccess request.

TemporaryCredential.Documentation:
// A TemporaryCredential object that contains the data needed to log in to the
// instance by RDP clients, such as the Microsoft Remote Desktop Connection.

AgentVersion.Documentation:
// The agent version. This parameter is set to INHERIT if the instance inherits
// the default stack setting or to a a version number for a fixed agent version.

AmiId.Documentation:
// A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. For more information,
// see Instances (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/userguide/workinginstances-custom-ami.html)

AutoScalingType.Documentation: // For load-based or time-based instances, the type.

AvailabilityZone.Documentation:
// The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints
// (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

BlockDeviceMappings.Documentation:
// An array of BlockDeviceMapping objects that specify the instance's block
// device mappings.

CreatedAt.Documentation: // The time that the instance was created.

EbsOptimized.Documentation: // Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.

Ec2InstanceId.Documentation: // The ID of the associated Amazon EC2 instance.

EcsClusterArn.Documentation: // For container instances, the Amazon ECS cluster's ARN.

EcsContainerInstanceArn.Documentation: // For container instances, the instance's ARN.

InfrastructureClass.Documentation: // For registered instances, the infrastructure class: ec2 or on-premises.

InstanceProfileArn.Documentation:
// The ARN of the instance's IAM profile. For more information about IAM ARNs,
// see Using Identifiers (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/Using_Identifiers.html).

InstanceType.Documentation: // The instance type, such as t2.micro.

LastServiceErrorId.Documentation: // The ID of the last service error. For more information, call DescribeServiceErrors.

LayerIds.Documentation: // An array containing the instance layer IDs.

PrivateDns.Documentation: // The The instance's private DNS name.

RegisteredBy.Documentation: // For registered instances, who performed the registration.

ReportedAgentVersion.Documentation: // The instance's reported AWS OpsWorks agent version.

ReportedOs.Documentation: // For registered instances, the reported operating system.

RootDeviceType.Documentation:
// The instance's root device type. For more information, see Storage for the
// Root Device (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ComponentsAMIs.html#storage-for-the-root-device).

SecurityGroupIds.Documentation: // An array containing the instance security group IDs.

SshHostDsaKeyFingerprint.Documentation: // The SSH key's Deep Security Agent (DSA) fingerprint.

SshKeyName.Documentation: // The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.

SubnetId.Documentation: // The instance's subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.

Tenancy.Documentation: // The instance's tenancy option, such as dedicated or host.

VirtualizationType.Documentation: // The instance's virtualization type: paravirtual or hvm.

InstanceIdentity.Documentation:
// Contains a description of an Amazon EC2 instance from the Amazon EC2 metadata
// service. For more information, see Instance Metadata and User Data (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdkfornet/latest/apidocs/Index.html).

Document.Documentation: // A JSON document that contains the metadata.

Signature.Documentation: // A signature that can be used to verify the document's accuracy and authenticity.

InstancesCount.Documentation: // Describes how many instances a stack has for each status.

Assigning.Documentation: // The number of instances in the Assigning state.

Booting.Documentation: // The number of instances with booting status.

ConnectionLost.Documentation: // The number of instances with connection_lost status.

Deregistering.Documentation: // The number of instances in the Deregistering state.

Online.Documentation: // The number of instances with online status.

Pending.Documentation: // The number of instances with pending status.

Rebooting.Documentation: // The number of instances with rebooting status.

Registered.Documentation: // The number of instances in the Registered state.

Registering.Documentation: // The number of instances in the Registering state.

Requested.Documentation: // The number of instances with requested status.

RunningSetup.Documentation: // The number of instances with running_setup status.

SetupFailed.Documentation: // The number of instances with setup_failed status.

ShuttingDown.Documentation: // The number of instances with shutting_down status.

StartFailed.Documentation: // The number of instances with start_failed status.

Stopped.Documentation: // The number of instances with stopped status.

Stopping.Documentation: // The number of instances with stopping status.

Terminated.Documentation: // The number of instances with terminated status.

Terminating.Documentation: // The number of instances with terminating status.

Unassigning.Documentation: // The number of instances in the Unassigning state.

AutoAssignElasticIps.Documentation:
// Whether to automatically assign an Elastic IP address (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/elastic-ip-addresses-eip.html)
// to the layer's instances. For more information, see How to Edit a Layer (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/userguide/workinglayers-basics-edit.html).

CreatedAt.Documentation: // Date when the layer was created.

CustomInstanceProfileArn.Documentation:
// The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances.
// For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/Using_Identifiers.html).

CustomJson.Documentation:
// A JSON formatted string containing the layer's custom stack configuration
// and deployment attributes.

CustomRecipes.Documentation: // A LayerCustomRecipes object that specifies the layer's custom recipes.

CustomSecurityGroupIds.Documentation: // An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.

DefaultSecurityGroupNames.Documentation: // An array containing the layer's security group names.

EnableAutoHealing.Documentation: // Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.

LifecycleEventConfiguration.Documentation: // A LifeCycleEventConfiguration object that specifies the Shutdown event configuration.

Packages.Documentation: // An array of Package objects that describe the layer's packages.

UseEbsOptimizedInstances.Documentation: // Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.

VolumeConfigurations.Documentation: // A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.

Shutdown.Documentation: // A ShutdownEventConfiguration object that specifies the Shutdown event configuration.

LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.Documentation: // Describes a layer's load-based auto scaling configuration.

DownScaling.Documentation:
// An AutoScalingThresholds object that describes the downscaling configuration,
// which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks reduces the number of instances.

Enable.Documentation: // Whether load-based auto scaling is enabled for the layer.

UpScaling.Documentation:
// An AutoScalingThresholds object that describes the upscaling configuration,
// which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks increases the number of instances.

AllowSsh.Documentation: // Whether the user can use SSH.

AllowSudo.Documentation: // Whether the user can use sudo.

IamUserArn.Documentation:
// The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access Management
// (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/Using_Identifiers.html).

AvailabilityZone.Documentation:
// The array's Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints
// (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

CreatedAt.Documentation: // When the RAID array was created.

Device.Documentation: // The array's Linux device. For example /dev/mdadm0.

Iops.Documentation: // For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.

NumberOfDisks.Documentation: // The number of disks in the array.

VolumeType.Documentation: // The volume type, standard or PIOPS.

DbPassword.Documentation: // AWS OpsWorks returns *****FILTERED***** instead of the actual value.

StackId.Documentation: // The ID of the stack that the instance is registered with.

Configure.Documentation: // An array of custom recipe names to be run following a configure event.

Deploy.Documentation: // An array of custom recipe names to be run following a deploy event.

Setup.Documentation: // An array of custom recipe names to be run following a setup event.

Shutdown.Documentation: // An array of custom recipe names to be run following a shutdown event.

Undeploy.Documentation: // An array of custom recipe names to be run following a undeploy event.

RegisterEcsClusterOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a RegisterEcsCluster request.

RegisterElasticIpOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a RegisterElasticIp request.

InstanceIdentity.Documentation: // An InstanceIdentity object that contains the instance's identity.

RsaPublicKey.Documentation:
// The instances public RSA key. This key is used to encrypt communication between
// the instance and the service.

RsaPublicKeyFingerprint.Documentation: // The instances public RSA key fingerprint.

StackId.Documentation: // The ID of the stack that the instance is to be registered with.

Ref.Documentation: // The ID of the stack that the instance is to be registered with.

RegisterInstanceOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a RegisterInstanceResult request.

InstanceId.Documentation: // The registered instance's AWS OpsWorks ID.

RegisterVolumeOutput.Documentation: // Contains the response to a RegisterVolume request.

ReportedOs.Documentation: // A registered instance's reported operating system.

ServiceError.Documentation: // Describes an AWS OpsWorks service error.

Message.Documentation: // A message that describes the error.

Enable.Documentation: // Enables load-based auto scaling for the layer.

AllowSsh.Documentation: // The user is allowed to use SSH to communicate with the instance.

AllowSudo.Documentation: // The user is allowed to use sudo to elevate privileges.

AutoScalingSchedule.Documentation: // An AutoScalingSchedule with the instance schedule.

DelayUntilElbConnectionsDrained.Documentation:
// Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more information,
// see Connection Draining (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/TerminologyandKeyConcepts.html#conn-drain)

ExecutionTimeout.Documentation:
// The time, in seconds, that AWS OpsWorks will wait after triggering a Shutdown
// event before shutting down an instance.

Certificate.Documentation: // The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.

Chain.Documentation:
// Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority key
// or client authentication.

PrivateKey.Documentation: // The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.

Ref.Documentation: // The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.
// The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.

AgentVersion.Documentation:
// The agent version. This parameter is set to LATEST for auto-update. or a
// version number for a fixed agent version.

ChefConfiguration.Documentation:
// A ChefConfiguration object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and
// the Berkshelf version. For more information, see Create a New Stack (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/userguide/workingstacks-creating.html).

CreatedAt.Documentation: // The date when the stack was created.

DefaultAvailabilityZone.Documentation:
// The stack's default Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions
// and Endpoints (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

DefaultSshKeyName.Documentation:
// A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can override
// this value when you create or update an instance.

DefaultSubnetId.Documentation: // The default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.

HostnameTheme.Documentation: // The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.

Region.Documentation:
// The stack AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about AWS
// regions, see Regions and Endpoints (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

ServiceRoleArn.Documentation: // The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.

UseCustomCookbooks.Documentation: // Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

UseOpsworksSecurityGroups.Documentation:
// Whether the stack automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks built-in security
// groups with the stack's layers.

VpcId.Documentation: // The VPC ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.

Name.Documentation: // The name. This parameter must be set to "Chef".

StackSummary.Documentation: // Summarizes the number of layers, instances, and apps in a stack.

InstancesCount.Documentation: // An InstancesCount object with the number of instances in each status.

TemporaryCredential.Documentation:
// Contains the data needed by RDP clients such as the Microsoft Remote Desktop
// Connection to log in to the instance.

TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.Documentation: // Describes an instance's time-based auto scaling configuration.

AutoScalingSchedule.Documentation: // A WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule object with the instance schedule.

AppSource.Documentation: // A Source object that specifies the app repository.

Attributes.Documentation: // One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

Domains.Documentation:
// The app's virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by commas.
// For example: 'www.example.com, example.com'

EnableSsl.Documentation: // Whether SSL is enabled for the app.

SslConfiguration.Documentation: // An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

Ref.Documentation: // An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

AutoScalingType.Documentation:
// For load-based or time-based instances, the type. Windows stacks can use
// only time-based instances.

SshKeyName.Documentation: // The instance's Amazon EC2 key name.

Attributes.Documentation: // One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

AutoAssignElasticIps.Documentation:
// Whether to automatically assign an Elastic IP address (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/elastic-ip-addresses-eip.html)
// to the layer's instances. For more information, see How to Edit a Layer (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/userguide/workinglayers-basics-edit.html).

CustomInstanceProfileArn.Documentation:
// The ARN of an IAM profile to be used for all of the layer's EC2 instances.
// For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/Using_Identifiers.html).

CustomRecipes.Documentation: // A LayerCustomRecipes object that specifies the layer's custom recipes.

CustomSecurityGroupIds.Documentation: // An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.

EnableAutoHealing.Documentation: // Whether to disable auto healing for the layer.

Name.Documentation: // The layer name, which is used by the console.

Packages.Documentation: // An array of Package objects that describe the layer's packages.

UseEbsOptimizedInstances.Documentation: // Whether to use Amazon EBS-optimized instances.

VolumeConfigurations.Documentation: // A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.

Ref.Documentation: // A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.

Attributes.Documentation: // One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

ServiceRoleArn.Documentation: // Do not use this parameter. You cannot update a stack's service role.

UseCustomCookbooks.Documentation: // Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

AllowSelfManagement.Documentation:
// Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My Settings
// page. For more information, see Managing User Permissions (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/userguide/security-settingsshkey.html).

SshPublicKey.Documentation: // The user's new SSH public key.

AllowSelfManagement.Documentation:
// Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My Settings
// page. For more information, see Managing User Permissions (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/opsworks/latest/userguide/security-settingsshkey.html).

Volume.Documentation: // Describes an instance's Amazon EBS volume.

AvailabilityZone.Documentation:
// The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints
// (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

Iops.Documentation: // For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.

MountPoint.Documentation: // The volume mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".

Region.Documentation:
// The AWS region. For more information about AWS regions, see Regions and Endpoints
// (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

VolumeType.Documentation: // The volume type, standard or PIOPS.

VolumeConfiguration.Documentation: // Describes an Amazon EBS volume configuration.

Iops.Documentation: // For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.

MountPoint.Documentation: // The volume mount point. For example "/dev/sdh".

NumberOfDisks.Documentation: // The number of disks in the volume.

Ref.Documentation: // The volume mount point. For example "/dev/sdh".
